parameters.repwage:
Wife's wage reported at the time of the 1976 interview 
(not the same as the 1975 estimated wage). To use the subsample with this wage,
one needs to select 1975 workers with participation == "yes", then select only those
women with non-zero wage. Only 325 women work in 1975 and have a non-zero wage in 1976.
parameters.experience: Actual years of wife's previous labor market experience.
parameters.hcollege: Factor. Did the individual's husband attend college?
parameters.meducation: Wife's mother's educational attainment, in years.
parameters.unemp:
Unemployment rate in county of residence, in percentage points.
(This is taken from bracketed ranges.)
parameters.tax:
Marginal tax rate facing the wife, and is taken from published federal 
tax tables (state and local income taxes are excluded). The taxable income on 
which this tax rate is calculated includes Social Security, if applicable to wife.
parameters.participation:
Factor. Did the individual participate in the labor force in 1975?
(This is essentially wage > 0 or hours > 0.)
parameters.fincome:
Family income, in 1975 dollars. (This variable is used to construct the
property income variable.)
parameters.college: Factor. Did the individual attend college?
parameters.city: Factor. Does the individual live in a large city?
parameters.youngkids: Number of children less than 6 years old in household.
parameters.oldkids: Number of children between ages 6 and 18 in household.
parameters.feducation: Wife's father's educational attainment, in years.
parameters.wage: Wife's average hourly wage, in 1975 dollars.

reference: This data set is also known as the Mroz (1987) data.
description:
Description
Cross-section data originating from the 1976 Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID),
based on data for the previous year, 1975.
title: Labor Force Participation Data
format: A data frame containing 753 observations on 21 variables.
